Greetings to Mozambican President 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to President Joaquim Alberto Chissano on June 20 on the occasion of the 26th anniversary of the independence of Mozambique and the proclamation of the Republic of Mozambique.
 Extending warm congratulations to the Mozambican President and people on the anniversary, the message hoped that the traditional relations of friendship between the two peoples would grow stronger.   
 It also wholeheartedly wished the president and the people of Mozambique success in the efforts for national unity and prosperity.

Greetings to Luxemburg Grand Duke 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Grand Duke Jean on June 21 on the occasion of the National Day of Luxemburg.
 In the message Kim warmly congratulated the Grand Duke and the people of Luxemburg on their National Day.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would expand and develop in various fields, the message sincerely wished the Grand Duke great success in his work.

articles.content:
Book "Cheers in June" popular in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A book "Cheers in June" is very popular among people in Jonju, North Jolla Province of South Korea, according to the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation.
 The book published on the occasion of the first anniversary of the historic Pyongyang meeting and the June 15 Joint Declaration has two chapters. The book carries pictures of leader Kim Jong Il taken during the Pyongyang meeting and legend-like stories told by South Korean people in profound reverence for him.    
 The book in its preface says that June will always be remembered by the fellow countrymen and humankind as a month when they came to know better about the peerlessly great man and as a month that produced new legends of high praises of the great man.

articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 21 sent a message of greetings to chief executive Pervez Musharraf upon his assumption of office as president of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan. 
 The message wished him success in his responsible work for building prosperous Pakistan and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
